title: Add option to remove contact from profile screen
body:
### Description
_Type_: Feature

_Summary_: Before #3570, there was an option to remove a contact from profile screen. Now it's gone and there is no way to remove a contact.

#### Expected behavior
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7532782/37470718-6f66177a-2868-11e8-950a-432fe8690b86.png)

#### Actual behavior
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7532782/37470522-feb9391c-2867-11e8-85bf-9fedd70e569a.png)

### Reproduction


* Open Status
* Start new chat
* Open profile of the person
* There should be an menu with option to remove the contact 

### Additional Information


* Status version: latest nightly
* Operating System: Android, iOS
* Issue was introduced in #3570
First we need to specify how "Remove contact" would work. Should a user still se my real name once I removed him/her from my contact list?
@StatusSceptre can we make this one a bounty?
Yes please add the appropriate labels “bounty-awaiting-approval” and an estimated size for fix. @mandrigin @yenda

@StatusSceptre ~~added XL label, because it requires changes in both status-go and status-react.~~

UPD: Mixed it up with removing account, changed to `m`.

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done
__This issue now has a funding of 240.0 DAI (240.0 USD @ $1.0/DAI) attached to it as part of the Status-im fund.__ * If you would like to work on this issue you can 'start work' [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/3585/2490). * Want to chip in? Add your own contribution [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/3585/2490). * Questions? Checkout Gitcoin Help or the Gitcoin Slack * $59,437.96 more funded OSS Work available on the [Gitcoin Issue Explorer](https://gitcoin.co/explorer)
@StatusSceptre @mandrigin -- I'll get started on this one and see if I can quickly resolve this issue. Let me know if there's anything I need to know in advance before jumping into this. Thanks!
@eswarasai we have a bottom sheet view, so it would be nice if you use it for this task. See `src/status_im/ui/screens/mobile_network_settings/events.cljs:L30`

@mandrigin -- At the moment, I just tried to get back the old functionality working which utilised `toolbar/actions`. Although the earlier implementation of `Remove from contacts` is basically hiding the user from the `Contacts` sections under `Profile` but if I go to the User Profile via Chat, I can still see that the user is added to my contacts with the `Remove from contacts` option.

I can go ahead and handle to hide the `Remove from contacts` option menu based on the hidden status of the contact. Just wanted to confirm if the above behaviour is the desired one. Thanks :)

@eswarasai Hello from Gitcoin Core - are you still working on this issue? Please submit a WIP PR or comment back within the next 3 days or you will be removed from this ticket and it will be returned to an ‘Open’ status. Please let us know if you have questions!
* [x] reminder (3 days)
* [ ] escalation to mods (6 days)

Funders only: Snooze warnings for [1 day](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/3585/2490?snooze=1) | [3 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/3585/2490?snooze=3) | [5 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/3585/2490?snooze=5) | [10 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/3585/2490?snooze=10) | [100 days](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/3585/2490?snooze=100)
@mandrigin -- Any update here? Also, is there any active dev channel that I can join to get instant response for further queries? Thanks :)

@eswarasai Thanks for your patience! Sorry to keep you waiting here. Best channel for more immediate response is:
#status-core http://get.status.im/chat/public/status-core
@StatusSceptre can you share the url to the 'Help' channel for otside of CET hours?

> @mandrigin -- At the moment, I just tried to get back the old functionality working which utilised `toolbar/actions`. Although the earlier implementation of `Remove from contacts` is basically hiding the user from the `Contacts` sections under `Profile` but if I go to the User Profile via Chat, I can still see that the user is added to my contacts with the `Remove from contacts` option.
> 
> I can go ahead and handle to hide the `Remove from contacts` option menu based on the hidden status of the contact. Just wanted to confirm if the above behaviour is the desired one. Thanks :)

Correct, hiding the Remove from contacts option menu is the desired behavior. AFAIK 'actual' contact removal can cause issues that are handled more elegantly by the 'block' user feature. Remove in a way is similar to removing a contact from your phone, it doesn't mean that they can't call you anymore. They are just no longer in your phonebook and you enable 'Caler ID' sort of speak.

Would love a second opinion though, @cammellos is it ok to simply hide 'Remove contact option' on Profile view after it's been used?

@hesterbruikman -- Thanks for the response. Whatever you've said makes sense. The only confusion is that, even though I've removed the user from the contacts, when I open the user profile, it still shows `In contacts` which can be confusing. I've already hidden the `Remove Contact` menu option. Just wanted to clear out things on the `In contacts` behaviour.

Alternative is to add a check if the user is hidden and display `Add to Contacts` button which will just toggle the value of hide user. Does this make sense to you?

> The only confusion is that, even though I've removed the user from the contacts, when I open the user profile, it still shows `In contacts` which can be confusing.

To see if I understand what's going on. Is this what happens?
- You tap on the [Remove from contacts] when viewing my [Hester] profile
- You go to your [Profile] tab in the bottom menu
- You go to [Contacts]
- You see my name [Hester] in the contact list

@hesterbruikman -- Sorry for the delayed response. But here's the flow with the screenshots: 1) Tap on the `Remove from contacts` when viewing user profile 2) In the `Contacts List` from `Profile` tab in the bottom menu, the user is not visible 3) But, when we navigate to the user profile from the chat by clicking on the user avatar, below is the screen that appears which can be confusing as it says `In Contacts` but there's no option to `Remove Contact` ### Note Another issue I've observed is, if I `Remove Contact`, quit and restart the app, I'm still able to see the `Contact` in the `Contacts List` from `Profile` tab in the bottom menu. I need to dig into this a little more. Just wanted to point it out. Thanks!

> @StatusSceptre can you share the url to the 'Help' channel for outside of CET hours?

btw there is ***#status-core-help*** for that
https://get.status.im/chat/public/status-core-help

It is where contributors like yourself(@eswarasai) hangout/voluntarily-help-each-other-out/discuss-any-other-concerns. Some with number of bounties and core-dev level experience under their belt.

No guarantees, but, please feel free to ask questions there during off CET hours when core-devs might not be available, or on CET hours and core-devs are way too busy.

Also, the chances of getting answer increases if more and more contributors joins the conversations there. So please join.

@eswarasai thanks for your patience on this! And @bitsikka thanks for jumping in. Indeed, #status-core-help should be a good place to get a faster response to questions.

> Another issue I've observed is, if I `Remove Contact`, quit and restart the app, I'm still able to see the `Contact` in the `Contacts List` from `Profile` tab in the bottom menu. I need to dig into this a little more. Just wanted to point it out. Thanks!

Got some advice from @yenda on what might be going on. There should be a function to delete the contact from the database. If the contact seems to be in contacts after restarting (either in the Contact list or as shown on the user profile image you last shared), it is likely that the contact is not removed from the database.

_Please keep me posted on how this issue is going. We struggle with the semantics of what a contact is and what it means to remove, block, etc. Therefore you might encounter more difficulties or unexpected behavior. If this is a blocker we can freeze this issue for now and invite you back once sorted._

@hesterbruikman -- No problem. Thanks for getting back to me with the response. I'll spend some more time and try to achieve the above intended behaviour without causing any repercussions, if possible. I'll reach out to you once I have better understanding or hit any blockers :)

@eswarasai Hello from Gitcoin Core - are you still working on this issue? Please submit a WIP PR or comment back within the next 3 days or you will be removed from this ticket and it will be returned to an ‘Open’ status. Please let us know if you have questions!
* [x] reminder (3 days)
* [ ] escalation to mods (6 days)

hi @eswarasai how are you getting on with this issue? if you have any questions, please reach out to https://get.status.im/chat/public/status-core-help
@hesterbruikman should we talk about this issue in the profile design meeting tomorrow?

<hr>

* [x] reminder (3 days)
* [x] escalation to mods (6 days)

@hesterbruikman -- Sorry for the delay in getting back on this issue. 

I've spent some time thinking about the semantics around removing vs blocking contact and also going through the existing implementation/functions. I came across `delete-contact-tx` method which is what you were referring to in the earlier comment, if I'm not wrong but it's not being used anywhere at the moment.

I'm new to Clojurescript and also it's really taking me a while to get my head wrapped around the architecture and the flow. So if this is issue is on priority I can stop work on it and make it available for someone else to pick it up and move it at fast pace. If not, I can try spending more efforts this weekend to get everything in place in order to get the desired behaviour.

Also, I'm curious to know if you guys have discussed about this issue in the Design call and any suggestions/feedback you've got for me in regards with the implementation. Thanks :)

@eswarasai Hello from Gitcoin Core - are you still working on this issue? Please submit a WIP PR or comment back within the next 3 days or you will be removed from this ticket and it will be returned to an ‘Open’ status. Please let us know if you have questions!

@hesterbruikman -- Any update here?

@eswarasai as you pointed out the semantics of deleting a contact are complex in this scenario. I think the best solution is to wait for my PR introducing system-tags to be merged https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/7805
Deleting a contact would mean removing the  :contact/added tag in that case
@yenda -- Thanks for the update. That makes sense to me and please do keep me posted once the PR is merged so that I can take this one forward :)
